name: Vegan Jelly Donuts
description: Vegan Jelly Donuts are pillowy soft, filled with raspberry jam and dusted with powdered sugar! Fry, bake or air fry.
recipeIngredient: 6 tablespoons vegan butter, softened to room temperature
4 cups all purpose flour, plus more as needed
8 ounces seedless raspberry jelly, or other jelly
powdered sugar, for dusting OR granulated sugar for rolling in

recipeInstructions.text: Microwave the soy milk for about 1 minute if refrigerated, so that it's as warm as bath water. You don't want it to boil, so watch closely. If you don't have a microwave, warm it in a small pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Microwave the soy milk for about 1 minute if refrigerated, so that it's as warm as bath water. You don't want it to boil, so watch closely. If you don't have a microwave, warm it in a small pan.

recipeInstructions.text: In a large bowl, or the bowl of a stand mixer, stir together the warm soy milk, yeast and sugar. Let the mixture sit for 3-4 minutes, until it's a bit frothy.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large bowl, or the bowl of a stand mixer, stir together the warm soy milk, yeast and sugar. Let the mixture sit for 3-4 minutes, until it's a bit frothy.

recipeInstructions.text: To the bowl with the yeast mixture, add the applesauce, softened vegan butter, vanilla, salt and 2 cups of flour. Mix on low speed with a dough hook, or by hand with a large wooden spoon, for a few minutes, then add the rest of the flour and continue to mix.
recipeInstructions.name: To the bowl with the yeast mixture, add the applesauce, softened vegan butter, vanilla, salt and 2 cups of flour. Mix on low speed with a dough hook, or by hand with a large wooden spoon, for a few minutes, then add the rest of the flour and continue to mix.

recipeInstructions.text: If using a stand mixer, beat with the dough hook for about 2-3 minutes. If you are making them by hand, mix it as well as you can with a spoon, then transfer to a lightly floured surface and knead the dough for about 5 minutes until you have a nice soft ball of dough.
recipeInstructions.name: If using a stand mixer, beat with the dough hook for about 2-3 minutes. If you are making them by hand, mix it as well as you can with a spoon, then transfer to a lightly floured surface and knead the dough for about 5 minutes until you have a nice soft ball of dough.

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly grease a large bowl (I use non-stick spray) then place the dough in the bowl. Cover with a clean kitchen towel, then allow to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes. I preheat my oven to 170℉, then turn it off and place the bowl inside with the door cracked.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly grease a large bowl (I use non-stick spray) then place the dough in the bowl. Cover with a clean kitchen towel, then allow to rise in a warm place for 30 minutes. I preheat my oven to 170℉, then turn it off and place the bowl inside with the door cracked.

recipeInstructions.text: After 30 minutes, punch the dough down. Place it on a lightly floured surface and roll it about 1/2 inch thick. Use a donut cutter or a large biscuit cutter to cut the donuts. You should get about 16-18.
recipeInstructions.name: After 30 minutes, punch the dough down. Place it on a lightly floured surface and roll it about 1/2 inch thick. Use a donut cutter or a large biscuit cutter to cut the donuts. You should get about 16-18.

recipeInstructions.text: Line a large baking sheet or two with parchment paper, and place the cut donuts on the pans. Cover with a large towel for about 15 minutes while you heat the oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Line a large baking sheet or two with parchment paper, and place the cut donuts on the pans. Cover with a large towel for about 15 minutes while you heat the oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 2-3 inches of oil in a large pan or pot until it reaches 375℉. I highly suggest using a thermometer so you get this just right.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 2-3 inches of oil in a large pan or pot until it reaches 375℉. I highly suggest using a thermometer so you get this just right.

recipeInstructions.text: Add a few donuts at a time to the oil and cook for about 1-2 minutes on each side, until golden brown, being careful not to let them get too dark and burnt. If the oil is hot, this won't take long. Be careful of hot oil!
recipeInstructions.name: Add a few donuts at a time to the oil and cook for about 1-2 minutes on each side, until golden brown, being careful not to let them get too dark and burnt. If the oil is hot, this won't take long. Be careful of hot oil!

recipeInstructions.text: Place the cooked donuts on a cooling rack with a pan or parchment paper underneath to catch any oil drippings. Repeat until all donuts are fried.
recipeInstructions.name: Place the cooked donuts on a cooling rack with a pan or parchment paper underneath to catch any oil drippings. Repeat until all donuts are fried.

recipeInstructions.text: Cut a deep slit into the side of each donut, then use a piping bag with tip to pipe jelly into each one. Dust the tops with powdered sugar or roll in granulated sugar. Serve and enjoy!
recipeInstructions.name: Cut a deep slit into the side of each donut, then use a piping bag with tip to pipe jelly into each one. Dust the tops with powdered sugar or roll in granulated sugar. Serve and enjoy!

itemListElement.text: Place the cut donuts on the parchment line baking sheet (or two, if needed). Cover with a tea towel and let them rise for about 15 minutes. While the donuts sit, preheat the oven to 350℉.
itemListElement.name: Place the cut donuts on the parchment line baking sheet (or two, if needed). Cover with a tea towel and let them rise for about 15 minutes. While the donuts sit, preheat the oven to 350℉.

itemListElement.text: Spray the donuts with oil, then bake for 10-15 minutes until lightly golden on top. If desired, brush the donuts with melted vegan butter right when they come out of the oven, then pipe with jelly and dust with powdered sugar.
itemListElement.name: Spray the donuts with oil, then bake for 10-15 minutes until lightly golden on top. If desired, brush the donuts with melted vegan butter right when they come out of the oven, then pipe with jelly and dust with powdered sugar.

itemListElement.text: Place the cut donuts on a parchment lined baking sheet, cover with a tea towel and let rise for about 15 minutes. Spray the air fryer basket with oil, then transfer the donuts to the air fryer in a single layer (about 3 at a time). Spray the donuts with oil.
itemListElement.name: Place the cut donuts on a parchment lined baking sheet, cover with a tea towel and let rise for about 15 minutes. Spray the air fryer basket with oil, then transfer the donuts to the air fryer in a single layer (about 3 at a time). Spray the donuts with oil.

itemListElement.text: Cook at 350℉ for 5 minutes, then flip the donuts and cook for 3-5 more minutes until golden brown. If desired, brush with melted vegan butter as soon as they come out. Remove from air fryer, pipe with jelly and dust with powdered sugar.
itemListElement.name: Cook at 350℉ for 5 minutes, then flip the donuts and cook for 3-5 more minutes until golden brown. If desired, brush with melted vegan butter as soon as they come out. Remove from air fryer, pipe with jelly and dust with powdered sugar.
